1�Welcome to the auction house.Do you have any questions about our establishment?

1�What do you want to know?What is the auction house?How are auctions run?Are there any fees?Are there any limits?How do you check up on merchandise?How do you remove an item?My ��Sales Status�� list is full!Nothing right now.
1�Auction houses can be found in all of Vana'diel's major cities. Here adventurers gather to bid on battle spoils, unwanted items, old armor...almost anything.
1�Adventurers may use any auction house regardless of nationality.
1�The first adventurer to bid at or above the asking price will automatically purchase the product.
1�Once put up for auction, merchandise will remain there for a maximum of thirty weeks Vana'diel time (nine-and-a-half days Earth time).
1�If merchandise does not sell within this time limit, it will be returned to the seller's current residence.
1�Transaction fees are proportional to the amount for which an item is put up on auction. The method of calculating this fee is different for single items and stackable items.
1�A transaction fee is collected when any merchandise is put up for auction. This fee is nonrefundable.
1�The International Auction House Committee, or IAHC, has declared that a maximum of seven items may be put up for auction at one time.
1�However, the IAHC has recently removed the limit to how many items one may purchase.
1�A small amount of time is required before new merchandise appears on our bid list.
1�Once an item appears on your ��Sales Status�� list, it may not immediately appear on the bid list. If you do not see your item on the bid list, try looking again at a later time.
1�If you would like to withdraw an item from an auction, you must travel to the auction house, and select ��Stop Sale�� from the ��Sales Status�� menu.
1�To remove an item from your ��Sales Status�� list, you must visit an auction counter to acknowledge the sale or return of your merchandise.
1�Otherwise, previously sold or returned items will fill up your list and prevent you from selling any more merchandise.
1�At any auction counter, open the ��Sales Status�� menu and acknowledge the transaction to clear it from the list.
1�Press the confirm button to remove any transaction colored yellow (sold) or red (returned).
1�In the past, many have amassed great wealth through the auction house. I hope you find fortune, too!
1�Is there anything else you would like to know?
1�Do you want me to teach you about your Mog House again, kupo?
1�Ask about your Mog House again?Don't ask.Ask.
1�So I'll teach you about each one of them! Ask me what you want to know about, kupo!
1�Choose the Mog House command you want to know about, kupo!
1�What do you want to know about?The Mog Safe.Storage.The Delivery Box.Changing jobs.Gardening.Changing the layout.Mog House invitations.I got it, thanks, kupo!
1�The Mog Safe is where I keep items that you can't carry! It's an especially secure and solid safe, kupo!
1�You can only put so many items in it, kupo... But I'll guard them even if it means my life, kupo!
1�Storage space becomes available when you place furniture in your Mog House using the ��Layout�� command, kupo!
1�It's almost exactly the same as using your Mog Safe, kupo!Leave your items here for me to look after, kupo!
1�The Delivery Box is where you can send letters to friends and receive items from various places, kupo!
1�You should take the items from your Delivery Box and put them in your inventory when they arrive, kupo!
1�If your Delivery Box is full, no more deliveries can be made, and you can't send any mail either, kupo!
1�You can send items and gil to your friends with the ��Send�� command, kupo!
1�(Sometimes, if a special force takes hold, you can even deliver items with the "Exclusive" attribute, kupo...!)
1�Changing people's jobs is a secret ability only we moogles can use, kupo!
1�And...the rest is a secret, kupo!
1�All moogles like taking care of plants, kupo!
1�As long as you have a flowerpot and seeds, I'll make it my personal responsibility to look after the plants you raise, kupo!
1�This Mog House is your very own room, kupo! But it's still a little bare, kupo...
1�It needs some furniture and maybe some paintings to make it more cozy, kupo!
1�If you find any during your travels, I'll help you lay them out, kupo! I can't wait, kupo!
1�Each item of furniture you place using the ��Layout�� command corresponds to a different element, kupo! The type of energy that envelops your Mog House changes depending on those elements, kupo!
1�When that energy changes, my powers change as well, kupo! Master, you should try placing all sorts of furniture in your Mog House, kupo!
1�You can invite party and alliance members into your Mog House, kupo!
1�You can show off your expensive furniture, have tea parties, plan your next great adventure--the possibilities are endless, kupo!
1�Are you sure, kupo? You know everything about your Mog House, kupo?
1�Are you sure?I'm sure!Maybe I'm not so sure...
1�And finally, a little bit of advice!
1�If you ever run into any problems, just ask your fellow adventurers for help!
1�If you type ��/ae Hello!��, then your message will be heard by many people.
1�If you type ��/ae�� followed by your issue or question, other adventurers will help you!
1�Remember that you can only do this while in town, kupo!
1�Welcome, Master! This is your home, the ��Mog House,�� kupo!
1�I'm a moogle! We moogles like taking care of houses and items! Nice to meet you, kupo!
1�I'll tell you all about your Mog House, kupo!

1�Press it and the ��Mog House�� menu will appear! Everything you can do in your Mog House is there, kupo!
1�There are lots of things you can do in your Mog House, kupo! It can be too much for some masters, kupo...

1�Umm, hmmm....I don't think this �[guy/gal] can do it...
1�W-w-wait!!! <Huff> <Puff> My...my name's Sylvie. Pleased to...to make your acquaintance, hee hee!
1�<Huff> ...Sorry, I'm an out-of-shape geomancer...and not a people person.
1�But Ikhi Askamot herself has charged me with this most splendiferous of responsibilities to help me overcome my shortcomings!
1�Ahhhhhh, uhhh, my task? Well, um, it's to help bring new geomancers into the fold. Yaaaaaay!
1�To tell the truth, the Order of Renaye is...kind of opposed to this whole pioneering thingamajig.
1�But! But! If Adoulin needs our assistance, we're gonna do everything we can!
1�Plus, Eastern Ulbuka's scenery scares me with its trees and rivers--without geomancers to lend their aid, what hope does the land have?
1�And you...you look like the geodancing type! Right? Right!?
1�Your move.Wha...?Slow down, Nellie.
1�I...yes, well...geomancers! You wanna be one, don'tcha?
1�I...yes, well...geomancers! You wanna be one, don'tcha?
1�...Sorry. I'm not terribly good at this sort of thing.
1�Try your hand at geomancy?I'd love to give it a go!Sounds like fun!
1�R-really!? Oh, how magnanitabular!
1�R-really!? Oh, how magnanitabular!
1�You're really sure? I mean really, really sure???
1�Hooray! Then let's roll up our sleeves and get started!
1�First, a quiz! What's Adoulin's oldest profession?That's right...geomancy!
1�But, well, even though it was known for, well, since forever, it never really took off until much later.
1�I'm a little fuzzy on the details. It's complicated. Something about the sirens of legends, or the five disciples of Sih Renaye... Gosh, I can never keep this stuff straight.
1�Oh, wait! Geomancy. Right.
1�Research into geomancy as a discipline started...well, started in Eastern Ulbuka as a way to counteract the dangers of nature, and took place over many, many years.
1�It's kinda similar to, yet totally different from, the pioneering efforts that occurred back then. What geomancy cares about is having a heart-to-heart with nature.
1�But that's at a really advanced level. Back then, only the best of the best could do it.
1�Well, you know...natural forces can be a bit cheeky, and don't like it when people try to expose their feelings.
1�Eventually, the ancient geomancers realized that the answer wasn't to control the land--could you imagine?--but rather let themselves be swept up by its current and borrow some of its strength.
1�We call that current the ��lifestream.�� The lifestream flows within Mother Nature kinda like how blood flows through you and me. It's all around us, even right now.

1�When we use the power of the lifestream, it's called using ��Geomantic Incantations,�� or simply ��Geomancy.�� Confusing, right? I know it threw me for a loop, having two words mean the same thing...
1�There are two types of geomancy. Power originating from the geomancer herself is known as ��Indi,�� and power originating from a mystic emanation known as a ��luopan�� is called ��Geo.��
1�Ikhi Askamot says that ancient geomancers gave names to all these terms to help people understand, but she also thinks that it's easier to just see for yourself.
1�It's like that old saying, you know? A picture is worth two in the bush, or something...? Sorry, I'm really bad at this.
1�Come on, you know what I mean! If you get your hands wet you'll learn more than if I blab on about it for hours.
1�S-so! In order to handle the excellentatiousness of geomancy, you first need a luopan!
1�Luopans are essential for being a world-class geomancer. They're like a loyal pet--until death do you part!
1�Except luopans don't run away one afternoon when you're seven years old, leaving you crying on your front doorstep.
1�'Course, most geomancers can't use luopans right after they become one. Become geomancers, I mean.
1�Lecture's over! Ready to get down and dirty?
1�Make a luopan?Yes!.........No.
1�Wh-what? I've been sitting here pouring my heart out, and you're gonna walk away just like that?
1�I knew I wasn't cut out for this... Oh, Ikhi, I did it again...
1�This is stupendelicious!
1�Let's get this party started before you bail on me!
1�Getting the materials for a luopan is really simple, so I know you'll be up for it.
1�You'll need two things--one #���� and 6����.
1�The luopan is a medium for you to get all friendly with nature. That's why you need the 3����.
1�You're from the Middle Lands, not Adoulin, so to make a really super-duper one, you should find some from an area in your homeland where energies flow through the soil.
1�That's all you need! Easy peasy, lemon squeezy. Just come back to me when you've got 'em!
1�You...really mean it? You're going to try?
1�Make a luopan?Yes!.........No.

1�It's gotta go to an ergon locus first.
1�It is only in these places, deeply connected with nature herself, that your luopan will be able to display its...<whisper> immense power.
1�Ah! Ergon locus, right. It's like I told you--places filled with natural power.
1�Though they exist through all of Vana'diel, here in Adoulin we call them ��ergon loci.��
1�You came into contact with them in the Middle Lands, I'm sure. Depending on the era and locale, some of them go by different names...I guess.
1�One of the fruits--low-hanging fruit, perhaps--of this pioneering whosy-whatsit is that we've discovered ergon loci in the Yahse Hunting Grounds and the Ceizak Battlegrounds.
1�I gotta be honest with you. As a geomancer, I'm not a big fan of messing with nature.
1�But sometimes you gotta take a long-term view, y'know?
1�This whole tug-of-war between nature and progress has always defined what Adoulin is.
1�Tohoho, listen to me! That was totally deep, right?
1�...Where were we? Oh, right, ergon loci. Bring your luopan to one of these loci and remain calm and steady.
1�Like this, see?
1�You gotta be focused, or else it won't work. It's the first step in becoming one with nature. Let the lifestream gently flow into your luopan.
1�You'll get all hot and bothered, so you'll know when it's happening. This is another one of those ��two in the bush�� things.
1�And just when you think you've had all you can stand and are about to explode...you'll finish and feel the warm embrace of release.
1�I'll have to touch up your luopan when you're done, so make sure to come back!
1�You know...the forest isn't the friendliest of locations. I'd hate for anything to happen to your precious luo--<cough> to you.
1�There you have it! Now get going!

1� �[How farrre you?/Hello!/May Altana guide you, pioneer./A pleasure to see you./A fair day to you./It is good to see you.]I am here to provide intrepid pioneers with assignments from the  �[Pioneers'/Peacekeepers'/Couriers'/Scouts'/Inventors'/Mummers'] Coalition.
1� , correct? Brenton here would like to have a word with you. He said it was important.
1� , is it not? Brenton at the Pioneers' Coalition has been looking for you. Please go see him at your earliest convenience.
1�The six coalitions here in Adoulin each require the help of pioneers in their own way to support the colonization effort. These tasks both directly and indirectly support the colonization effort.

1�We will, of course, pay appropriate recompense to those completing these assignments. Further, the Twelve Orders will recognize your efforts as you continue to accomplish these goals, and may even provide you with more important duties as you begin to make a name for yourself.
1�Perhaps more significantly, the influence of each coalition will expand as more pioneers fulfill these obligations, and the Twelve Orders will permit them to expand.
1�This, in turn, will enable the coalitions to increase the number and quality of the services they provide, thereby enabling them to contribute to the colonization project even more.

1�Likewise, if one coalition does not receive enough pioneer support, it may shrink in scale, even if it had previously expanded. It is for this reason that we try to make our assignments as lucrative as feasible.

1�However, we want to ensure that all pioneers are able to contribute equally. As such, the number of coalition assignments that can be undertaken each day is governed by a system comprised of imprimaturs.

1�You will have to part with one imprimatur per job you undertake. Each pioneer may possess up to 
� of such permits, with additional imprimaturs distributed at set intervals.

1�One benefit of this system is that you are able to contribute at your own pace. You may save up imprimaturs over a period of time and fill many orders at once, or you may instead use them as they come in.
1�Additionally, you can choose to spend multiple imprimaturs for one task. Predictably, you will receive rewards commensurate with the number of imprimaturs used.

1�The convenience of pioneers was our foremost priority when establishing this system. You may use all your imprimaturs to support a particular coalition, or you may instead choose to distribute them among several.

1�You may also cancel an assignment after it has been accepted. Any imprimaturs used will be returned to you--unless this would put you over the maximum amount, in which case they will be destroyed.
1�There is another aspect of the system I have not yet touched on: ��coalition referendums.��
1�The coalition referendums help determine how a particular coalition is going to expand. Pioneers are able to vote on which direction the coalition should head.
1�When you complete an assignment, you will be asked to choose which plan the coalition should prioritize.
1�A coalition's expansion and services are inexorably intertwined, so take ample stock of which services are on offer before casting your ballot.
1�The expansion process will take approximately one week (Earth time). Note that coalitions that have not received much pioneer contribution will not expand.
1�I know this is a lot of information to take in, but it is an essential part of your pioneering activities in Ulbuka.

1� , correct? Brenton here would like to have a word with you. He said it was important.
1� , is it not? Brenton at the Pioneers' Coalition has been looking for you. Please go see him at your earliest convenience.
1�The six coalitions here in Adoulin each require the help of pioneers in their own way to support the colonization effort. These tasks both directly and indirectly support the colonization effort.

1�We will, of course, pay appropriate recompense to those completing these assignments. Further, the Twelve Orders will recognize your efforts as you continue to accomplish these goals, and may even provide you with more important duties as you begin to make a name for yourself.
1�Perhaps more significantly, the influence of each coalition will expand as more pioneers fulfill these obligations, and the Twelve Orders will permit them to expand.
1�This, in turn, will enable the coalitions to increase the number and quality of the services they provide, thereby enabling them to contribute to the colonization project even more.

1�Likewise, if one coalition does not receive enough pioneer support, it may shrink in scale, even if it had previously expanded. It is for this reason that we try to make our assignments as lucrative as feasible.

1�However, we want to ensure that all pioneers are able to contribute equally. As such, the number of coalition assignments that can be undertaken each day is governed by a system comprised of imprimaturs.

1�You will have to part with one imprimatur per job you undertake. Each pioneer may possess up to 
� of such permits, with additional imprimaturs distributed at set intervals.

1�One benefit of this system is that you are able to contribute at your own pace. You may save up imprimaturs over a period of time and fill many orders at once, or you may instead use them as they come in.
1�Additionally, you can choose to spend multiple imprimaturs for one task. Predictably, you will receive rewards commensurate with the number of imprimaturs used.

1�The convenience of pioneers was our foremost priority when establishing this system. You may use all your imprimaturs to support a particular coalition, or you may instead choose to distribute them among several.

1�You may also cancel an assignment after it has been accepted. Any imprimaturs used will be returned to you--unless this would put you over the maximum amount, in which case they will be destroyed.
1�There is another aspect of the system I have not yet touched on: ��coalition referendums.��
1�The coalition referendums help determine how a particular coalition is going to expand. Pioneers are able to vote on which direction the coalition should head.
1�When you complete an assignment, you will be asked to choose which plan the coalition should prioritize.
1�A coalition's expansion and services are inexorably intertwined, so take ample stock of which services are on offer before casting your ballot.
1�The expansion process will take approximately one week (Earth time). Note that coalitions that have not received much pioneer contribution will not expand.
1�I know this is a lot of information to take in, but it is an essential part of your pioneering activities in Ulbuka.

1� �[How farrre you?/Hello!/May Altana guide you, pioneer./A pleasure to see you./A fair day to you./It is good to see you.]I am here to provide intrepid pioneers with assignments from the  �[Pioneers'/Peacekeepers'/Couriers'/Scouts'/Inventors'/Mummers'] Coalition.
1� , correct? Brenton here would like to have a word with you. He said it was important.
1� , is it not? Brenton at the Pioneers' Coalition has been looking for you. Please go see him at your earliest convenience.
1�The six coalitions here in Adoulin each require the help of pioneers in their own way to support the colonization effort. These tasks both directly and indirectly support the colonization effort.

1�We will, of course, pay appropriate recompense to those completing these assignments. Further, the Twelve Orders will recognize your efforts as you continue to accomplish these goals, and may even provide you with more important duties as you begin to make a name for yourself.
1�Perhaps more significantly, the influence of each coalition will expand as more pioneers fulfill these obligations, and the Twelve Orders will permit them to expand.
1�This, in turn, will enable the coalitions to increase the number and quality of the services they provide, thereby enabling them to contribute to the colonization project even more.

1�Likewise, if one coalition does not receive enough pioneer support, it may shrink in scale, even if it had previously expanded. It is for this reason that we try to make our assignments as lucrative as feasible.

1�However, we want to ensure that all pioneers are able to contribute equally. As such, the number of coalition assignments that can be undertaken each day is governed by a system comprised of imprimaturs.

1�You will have to part with one imprimatur per job you undertake. Each pioneer may possess up to 
� of such permits, with additional imprimaturs distributed at set intervals.

1�One benefit of this system is that you are able to contribute at your own pace. You may save up imprimaturs over a period of time and fill many orders at once, or you may instead use them as they come in.
1�Additionally, you can choose to spend multiple imprimaturs for one task. Predictably, you will receive rewards commensurate with the number of imprimaturs used.

1�The convenience of pioneers was our foremost priority when establishing this system. You may use all your imprimaturs to support a particular coalition, or you may instead choose to distribute them among several.

1�You may also cancel an assignment after it has been accepted. Any imprimaturs used will be returned to you--unless this would put you over the maximum amount, in which case they will be destroyed.
1�There is another aspect of the system I have not yet touched on: ��coalition referendums.��
1�The coalition referendums help determine how a particular coalition is going to expand. Pioneers are able to vote on which direction the coalition should head.
1�When you complete an assignment, you will be asked to choose which plan the coalition should prioritize.
1�A coalition's expansion and services are inexorably intertwined, so take ample stock of which services are on offer before casting your ballot.
1�The expansion process will take approximately one week (Earth time). Note that coalitions that have not received much pioneer contribution will not expand.
1�I know this is a lot of information to take in, but it is an essential part of your pioneering activities in Ulbuka.

1� �[Why, hello there, my dear pioneer!/Good day to you./Hello, pioneer./Welcome to our establishmentaru!/I hope you're having a marvelous-warvelous day!/Welcome back!]Is there anything you'd like to know about the  �[Pioneers'/Peacekeepers'/Couriers'/Scouts'/Inventors'/Mummers'] Coalition?

1�What would you like to know about?The  �[Pioneers'/Peacekeepers'/Couriers'/Scouts'/Inventors'/Mummers'] Coalition's role.The state of the  �[Pioneers'/Peacekeepers'/Couriers'/Scouts'/Inventors'/Mummers'] Coalition.Types of coalition assignments.Current expansion plans.Coalition referendum support.Your current standing.Nothing.
1�The Pioneers' Coalition contributes to the colonization effort mainly by cultivating uninhabitable territory and preparing the necessary resources to do so.
1�It would take no stretch of the imagination to say that our coalition is the standard-bearer for the whole movement, what with all the brave young men and women that swell our ranks.

1�The maester who leads our family of settlers is Lhe Lhangavo from the Order of Karieyh. She's possibly the most passionate of any order leader, and certainly one of the most caring. She's always looking out for her subordinates.
1�The Peacekeepers' Coalition has the most self-explanatory name I'm sure you've ever heard. We work towards making Adoulin a safer place.
1�We're composed of only the most dedicated and dutiful individuals--people willing to give their lives to protect this town and its populace.

1�The great--though often grumpy--Gratzigg is our maester, but despite his sour demeanor, he's the most loyal of anyone in the Twelve Orders. His love for Adoulin has saved it from utter despair more times than I care to remember.
1�The Couriers' Coalition does its part by transporting supplies to the front lines. We also ensure the integrity of every shipment's cargo.
1�We're very punctual and really strict about getting our deliveries right. We have the reputation of being uptight because of it, but it's those qualities that keep the pioneering movement going.
1�Reginald serves as our maester. He may not be the most talkative person you've ever met, but just try to find a more gentlemanly gentleman among the Twelve Orders.
1�The Scouts' Coalition gathers intelligence from all over the continentaru and analyzes unknown materials to further the colonization movement.
1�The knowledge our coalition accrues, coupled-woupled with our innate knack for careful archival supervision, makes us indispensable in this era.

1�Our maestaru, Margret, belongs to the Order of Haverton. Her sheer brilliance-williance makes appetizers out of even the most difficult problems, so it's no wonder that she is seen as one of the greatest minds in Adoulin.
1�The Inventors' Coalition mainly supportarus pioneers and the colonization of Ulbuka through the development of tools and equipment.

1�We provide an economic foundation-wation for the city and the pioneering movement by using the materials pioneers bring us to create new foodstuffs that can last an ocean voyage, along with new articles to outfitaru explorers.

1�Our maester is the one-and-only Amchuchu from the Order of Orvail. Her skills and mind are more renowned than possibly any other maester in Adoulin's history-wistory, making her one of our most talented technicians.
1�The number one concern for the Mummers' Coalition is pioneer morale.

1�It may seem like all we do is spout japes and cavort about, but there is a method to our apparent madness. Soothing the spirits of pioneers has a proven economic benefit, so expect to see Mummer-sponsored events for some time to come.

1�Flaviria from the Order of Thurandaut heads our troupe, and I've never seen anyone who can spin a yarn or tell a joke quite like her. It's obvious that someone with her personality would be loved by both the nobility and common folk.

1�What assignments will you ask about?Procuring resources.Clearing the way.Preserving the peace.Patrols.Base provisions.Delivering supplies.Frontline support.Land surveys.Component analysis.Gathering materials.Recovering lost articles.Behavioral research.Morale boosting.Nothing.

1�Head out into the world and gather vital pioneering resources via methods such as mining and logging. Simply purchasing the supplies tells the coalition nothing of your abilities, however, and those who do will receive no remuneration.
1�It may seem like a thankless job, but the erection of coalition expansions and frontier stations demands constant provisioning, so it is not a task to be taken lightly.

1�Natural obstacles pop up from time to time, and pioneers are often asked to engage in a bit of bushwhacking to clear them away so the colonization movement can proceed. The only way to be officially recognized for such feats, though, is by participating in Colonization Reives.

1�The perils are aptly named, for many pioneers have fallen in attempts to rid the land of them. So many, in fact, that Maester Lhangavo was bereft of a few fur clumps for some time worrying over the issue.

1�Peace in Adoulin is a precarious thing. Fiends could assault the city at any moment, which is why we need to nip this problem in the bud. Join Lair Reives to eliminate their breeding grounds and contribute to the colonization effort.

1�If only the instinct to rebuild their homes were not so engrained in these hellions, life would be much easier for us. Sadly, you'll need to participate in these reives periodically in order to keep Ulbuka habitable.

1�While the Peacekeepers' Coalition often makes its rounds in the city itself, these patrols will take you to specific jungle locales for the express purpose of culling unwanted pests. Make sure to slay your quota, though, or you won't receive any recognition for your deeds.

1�Give Adoulin's population some peace of mind by embarking on these expeditions every so often. Also, rumors about far more terrifying beasts are likely to surface the further we progress into Ulbuka's interior, but as long as you stick to your duties, you should have no reason to fear them.

1�For these assignments, you'll need to transport provisions to the sites of future frontier stations. You can now use waypoints and still receive commendations, but be prepared to hear stories about ��back in my day, we had to walk all the way out and back on our own two feet,�� from some wily veterans.
1�Frontier stations are paramount to sustaining the colonization effort. Tasks of greater magnitude can't even begin without one, so building these structures should always be a priority.
1�You will sometimes be charged with carrying supplies from specific frontier stations to the Couriers' Coalition.

1�By supplies, I mean ones obtained in the jungle through pioneering. Yes, acting as a beast of burden may not be the most glamorous duty, but it is a vital one if we're to improve the coalitions and keep Adoulin economically stable.

1�The most effective way of supporting those risking their lives on the front lines is by supplying designated frontier bivouacs with the necessary provisions. While it may go against previous Couriers' Coalition policy, the use of waypoints is henceforth permitted on this type of assignment.

1�Truth be told, frontier bivouacs are not as developed as their station counterparts, but they still play an important role in the colonization of the continent. If they don't receive provisions regularly, our supply lines to the stations will wither and die.

1�Travel to places unknown in search of ergon loci, areas overflowing with natural energy. While some say it's the journey--not the destination--that matters, failing to survey even a single locus will leave you both depleted of energy and empty-handed.

1�The potency of an ergon tincture is highly dependent upon the strength of the ergon locus from which it's extracted, so a thorough investigation must be made into each location if we're to successfully use this trump card we've created.

1�Completion of these assignments means providing the Scouts' Coalition--and no others, for they are the only ones to possess the proper facilities--with unique and extraordinary materials from certain territories.

1�The jungle is teeming with obscure and unfamiliar substances, and from them we hope to derive more powerful and effective materials with which to aid the colonization effort. Science waits for no man, however, and without periodic deliveries of new samples, our research will stagnate.
1�The proper equipment and tools are instrumental in the colonization movement's progress--and the Inventors' Coalition apparently wants to be the one to corner the market.

1�While the Inventors' Coalition doesn't particularly care how you obtain what they ask for once you're in the specified location, they are quite picky about the number you obtain and the fact that you can't deliver to anyone else.

1�Pioneers are an intrepid band of adventurers, but the nature of their trade makes them prone to losing personal effects. Pick up any lost articles in the territory to which you are dispatched and return for a reward along with a pat on the back.
1�This is probably the least garish service the Mummers' Coalition provides, but it's one for which pioneers throughout Adoulin are eternally grateful.

1�Though they may not be the friendliest of Ulbuka's inhabitants, that doesn't mean the fiends who populate the continent can't teach us a thing or two. Research designated beasts by personally experiencing their special attacks and report what they taught you...if you live to tell the tale.

1�The Mummers' Coalition is constantly searching for its muse in all manner of sources, one being the myriad monsters scattered throughout the jungle. Investigating monsters' behavior may be just the inspiration they need to concoct new dances, gags, and events!

1�The isolation of the frontier can eat at even the most independent of us, which is why it's important to give our pioneers something to cheer about. Head to specified frontier stations and lift the spirits of the workers there! Just remember that if they don't smile, you don't get rewarded.
1�Dance, sing, shout, or generally make a fool of yourself. It doesn't matter how you do it, as long as you can make them laugh and forget their cares for a few moments.
1�This coalition is edified as much as possible, and therefore we have no plans to expand.

1�What would you like to know about?The  �[Pioneers'/Peacekeepers'/Couriers'/Scouts'/Inventors'/Mummers'] Coalition's role.The state of the  �[Pioneers'/Peacekeepers'/Couriers'/Scouts'/Inventors'/Mummers'] Coalition.Types of coalition assignments.Current expansion plans.Coalition referendum support.Your current standing.Nothing.
1�The Pioneers' Coalition contributes to the colonization effort mainly by cultivating uninhabitable territory and preparing the necessary resources to do so.
1�It would take no stretch of the imagination to say that our coalition is the standard-bearer for the whole movement, what with all the brave young men and women that swell our ranks.

1�The maester who leads our family of settlers is Lhe Lhangavo from the Order of Karieyh. She's possibly the most passionate of any order leader, and certainly one of the most caring. She's always looking out for her subordinates.
1�The Peacekeepers' Coalition has the most self-explanatory name I'm sure you've ever heard. We work towards making Adoulin a safer place.
1�We're composed of only the most dedicated and dutiful individuals--people willing to give their lives to protect this town and its populace.

1�The great--though often grumpy--Gratzigg is our maester, but despite his sour demeanor, he's the most loyal of anyone in the Twelve Orders. His love for Adoulin has saved it from utter despair more times than I care to remember.
1�The Couriers' Coalition does its part by transporting supplies to the front lines. We also ensure the integrity of every shipment's cargo.
1�We're very punctual and really strict about getting our deliveries right. We have the reputation of being uptight because of it, but it's those qualities that keep the pioneering movement going.
1�Reginald serves as our maester. He may not be the most talkative person you've ever met, but just try to find a more gentlemanly gentleman among the Twelve Orders.
1�The Scouts' Coalition gathers intelligence from all over the continentaru and analyzes unknown materials to further the colonization movement.
1�The knowledge our coalition accrues, coupled-woupled with our innate knack for careful archival supervision, makes us indispensable in this era.

1�Our maestaru, Margret, belongs to the Order of Haverton. Her sheer brilliance-williance makes appetizers out of even the most difficult problems, so it's no wonder that she is seen as one of the greatest minds in Adoulin.
1�The Inventors' Coalition mainly supportarus pioneers and the colonization of Ulbuka through the development of tools and equipment.

1�We provide an economic foundation-wation for the city and the pioneering movement by using the materials pioneers bring us to create new foodstuffs that can last an ocean voyage, along with new articles to outfitaru explorers.

1�Our maester is the one-and-only Amchuchu from the Order of Orvail. Her skills and mind are more renowned than possibly any other maester in Adoulin's history-wistory, making her one of our most talented technicians.
1�The number one concern for the Mummers' Coalition is pioneer morale.

1�It may seem like all we do is spout japes and cavort about, but there is a method to our apparent madness. Soothing the spirits of pioneers has a proven economic benefit, so expect to see Mummer-sponsored events for some time to come.

1�Flaviria from the Order of Thurandaut heads our troupe, and I've never seen anyone who can spin a yarn or tell a joke quite like her. It's obvious that someone with her personality would be loved by both the nobility and common folk.

Great? Then keep up the excellent work!]

1�You've all been  [abysmal/uninspiring/decent/remarkable/positively miraculous] at accomplishing your coalition assignments.Our coalition's rank  [will almost certainly fall/may fall/will probably stay about the same/might rise/will almost certainly rise] after the next evaluation.

1�What assignments will you ask about?Procuring resources.Clearing the way.Preserving the peace.Patrols.Base provisions.Delivering supplies.Frontline support.Land surveys.Component analysis.Gathering materials.Recovering lost articles.Behavioral research.Morale boosting.Nothing.

1�Head out into the world and gather vital pioneering resources via methods such as mining and logging. Simply purchasing the supplies tells the coalition nothing of your abilities, however, and those who do will receive no remuneration.
1�It may seem like a thankless job, but the erection of coalition expansions and frontier stations demands constant provisioning, so it is not a task to be taken lightly.

1�Natural obstacles pop up from time to time, and pioneers are often asked to engage in a bit of bushwhacking to clear them away so the colonization movement can proceed. The only way to be officially recognized for such feats, though, is by participating in Colonization Reives.

1�The perils are aptly named, for many pioneers have fallen in attempts to rid the land of them. So many, in fact, that Maester Lhangavo was bereft of a few fur clumps for some time worrying over the issue.

1�Peace in Adoulin is a precarious thing. Fiends could assault the city at any moment, which is why we need to nip this problem in the bud. Join Lair Reives to eliminate their breeding grounds and contribute to the colonization effort.

1�If only the instinct to rebuild their homes were not so engrained in these hellions, life would be much easier for us. Sadly, you'll need to participate in these reives periodically in order to keep Ulbuka habitable.

1�While the Peacekeepers' Coalition often makes its rounds in the city itself, these patrols will take you to specific jungle locales for the express purpose of culling unwanted pests. Make sure to slay your quota, though, or you won't receive any recognition for your deeds.

1�Give Adoulin's population some peace of mind by embarking on these expeditions every so often. Also, rumors about far more terrifying beasts are likely to surface the further we progress into Ulbuka's interior, but as long as you stick to your duties, you should have no reason to fear them.

1�For these assignments, you'll need to transport provisions to the sites of future frontier stations. You can now use waypoints and still receive commendations, but be prepared to hear stories about ��back in my day, we had to walk all the way out and back on our own two feet,�� from some wily veterans.
1�Frontier stations are paramount to sustaining the colonization effort. Tasks of greater magnitude can't even begin without one, so building these structures should always be a priority.
1�You will sometimes be charged with carrying supplies from specific frontier stations to the Couriers' Coalition.

1�By supplies, I mean ones obtained in the jungle through pioneering. Yes, acting as a beast of burden may not be the most glamorous duty, but it is a vital one if we're to improve the coalitions and keep Adoulin economically stable.

1�The most effective way of supporting those risking their lives on the front lines is by supplying designated frontier bivouacs with the necessary provisions. While it may go against previous Couriers' Coalition policy, the use of waypoints is henceforth permitted on this type of assignment.

1�Truth be told, frontier bivouacs are not as developed as their station counterparts, but they still play an important role in the colonization of the continent. If they don't receive provisions regularly, our supply lines to the stations will wither and die.

1�Travel to places unknown in search of ergon loci, areas overflowing with natural energy. While some say it's the journey--not the destination--that matters, failing to survey even a single locus will leave you both depleted of energy and empty-handed.

1�The potency of an ergon tincture is highly dependent upon the strength of the ergon locus from which it's extracted, so a thorough investigation must be made into each location if we're to successfully use this trump card we've created.

1�Completion of these assignments means providing the Scouts' Coalition--and no others, for they are the only ones to possess the proper facilities--with unique and extraordinary materials from certain territories.

1�The jungle is teeming with obscure and unfamiliar substances, and from them we hope to derive more powerful and effective materials with which to aid the colonization effort. Science waits for no man, however, and without periodic deliveries of new samples, our research will stagnate.
1�The proper equipment and tools are instrumental in the colonization movement's progress--and the Inventors' Coalition apparently wants to be the one to corner the market.

1�While the Inventors' Coalition doesn't particularly care how you obtain what they ask for once you're in the specified location, they are quite picky about the number you obtain and the fact that you can't deliver to anyone else.

1�Pioneers are an intrepid band of adventurers, but the nature of their trade makes them prone to losing personal effects. Pick up any lost articles in the territory to which you are dispatched and return for a reward along with a pat on the back.
1�This is probably the least garish service the Mummers' Coalition provides, but it's one for which pioneers throughout Adoulin are eternally grateful.

1�Though they may not be the friendliest of Ulbuka's inhabitants, that doesn't mean the fiends who populate the continent can't teach us a thing or two. Research designated beasts by personally experiencing their special attacks and report what they taught you...if you live to tell the tale.

1�The Mummers' Coalition is constantly searching for its muse in all manner of sources, one being the myriad monsters scattered throughout the jungle. Investigating monsters' behavior may be just the inspiration they need to concoct new dances, gags, and events!

1�The isolation of the frontier can eat at even the most independent of us, which is why it's important to give our pioneers something to cheer about. Head to specified frontier stations and lift the spirits of the workers there! Just remember that if they don't smile, you don't get rewarded.
1�Dance, sing, shout, or generally make a fool of yourself. It doesn't matter how you do it, as long as you can make them laugh and forget their cares for a few moments.
1�This coalition is edified as much as possible, and therefore we have no plans to expand.

1� �[Why, hello there, my dear pioneer!/Good day to you./Hello, pioneer./Welcome to our establishmentaru!/I hope you're having a marvelous-warvelous day!/Welcome back!]Is there anything you'd like to know about the  �[Pioneers'/Peacekeepers'/Couriers'/Scouts'/Inventors'/Mummers'] Coalition?

1�What would you like to know about?The  �[Pioneers'/Peacekeepers'/Couriers'/Scouts'/Inventors'/Mummers'] Coalition's role.The state of the  �[Pioneers'/Peacekeepers'/Couriers'/Scouts'/Inventors'/Mummers'] Coalition.Types of coalition assignments.Current expansion plans.Coalition referendum support.Your current standing.Nothing.
1�The Pioneers' Coalition contributes to the colonization effort mainly by cultivating uninhabitable territory and preparing the necessary resources to do so.
1�It would take no stretch of the imagination to say that our coalition is the standard-bearer for the whole movement, what with all the brave young men and women that swell our ranks.

1�The maester who leads our family of settlers is Lhe Lhangavo from the Order of Karieyh. She's possibly the most passionate of any order leader, and certainly one of the most caring. She's always looking out for her subordinates.
1�The Peacekeepers' Coalition has the most self-explanatory name I'm sure you've ever heard. We work towards making Adoulin a safer place.
1�We're composed of only the most dedicated and dutiful individuals--people willing to give their lives to protect this town and its populace.

1�The great--though often grumpy--Gratzigg is our maester, but despite his sour demeanor, he's the most loyal of anyone in the Twelve Orders. His love for Adoulin has saved it from utter despair more times than I care to remember.
1�The Couriers' Coalition does its part by transporting supplies to the front lines. We also ensure the integrity of every shipment's cargo.
1�We're very punctual and really strict about getting our deliveries right. We have the reputation of being uptight because of it, but it's those qualities that keep the pioneering movement going.
1�Reginald serves as our maester. He may not be the most talkative person you've ever met, but just try to find a more gentlemanly gentleman among the Twelve Orders.
1�The Scouts' Coalition gathers intelligence from all over the continentaru and analyzes unknown materials to further the colonization movement.
1�The knowledge our coalition accrues, coupled-woupled with our innate knack for careful archival supervision, makes us indispensable in this era.

1�Our maestaru, Margret, belongs to the Order of Haverton. Her sheer brilliance-williance makes appetizers out of even the most difficult problems, so it's no wonder that she is seen as one of the greatest minds in Adoulin.
1�The Inventors' Coalition mainly supportarus pioneers and the colonization of Ulbuka through the development of tools and equipment.

1�We provide an economic foundation-wation for the city and the pioneering movement by using the materials pioneers bring us to create new foodstuffs that can last an ocean voyage, along with new articles to outfitaru explorers.

1�Our maester is the one-and-only Amchuchu from the Order of Orvail. Her skills and mind are more renowned than possibly any other maester in Adoulin's history-wistory, making her one of our most talented technicians.
1�The number one concern for the Mummers' Coalition is pioneer morale.

1�It may seem like all we do is spout japes and cavort about, but there is a method to our apparent madness. Soothing the spirits of pioneers has a proven economic benefit, so expect to see Mummer-sponsored events for some time to come.

1�Flaviria from the Order of Thurandaut heads our troupe, and I've never seen anyone who can spin a yarn or tell a joke quite like her. It's obvious that someone with her personality would be loved by both the nobility and common folk.

1�The  �[Pioneers'/Peacekeepers'/Couriers'/Scouts'/Inventors'/Mummers'] Coalition is currently rank number

Great? Then keep up the excellent work!]

1�You've all been  [abysmal/uninspiring/decent/remarkable/positively miraculous] at accomplishing your coalition assignments.Our coalition's rank  [will almost certainly fall/may fall/will probably stay about the same/might rise/will almost certainly rise] after the next evaluation.

1�What assignments will you ask about?Procuring resources.Clearing the way.Preserving the peace.Patrols.Base provisions.Delivering supplies.Frontline support.Land surveys.Component analysis.Gathering materials.Recovering lost articles.Behavioral research.Morale boosting.Nothing.

1�Head out into the world and gather vital pioneering resources via methods such as mining and logging. Simply purchasing the supplies tells the coalition nothing of your abilities, however, and those who do will receive no remuneration.
1�It may seem like a thankless job, but the erection of coalition expansions and frontier stations demands constant provisioning, so it is not a task to be taken lightly.

1�Natural obstacles pop up from time to time, and pioneers are often asked to engage in a bit of bushwhacking to clear them away so the colonization movement can proceed. The only way to be officially recognized for such feats, though, is by participating in Colonization Reives.

1�The perils are aptly named, for many pioneers have fallen in attempts to rid the land of them. So many, in fact, that Maester Lhangavo was bereft of a few fur clumps for some time worrying over the issue.

1�Peace in Adoulin is a precarious thing. Fiends could assault the city at any moment, which is why we need to nip this problem in the bud. Join Lair Reives to eliminate their breeding grounds and contribute to the colonization effort.

1�If only the instinct to rebuild their homes were not so engrained in these hellions, life would be much easier for us. Sadly, you'll need to participate in these reives periodically in order to keep Ulbuka habitable.

1�While the Peacekeepers' Coalition often makes its rounds in the city itself, these patrols will take you to specific jungle locales for the express purpose of culling unwanted pests. Make sure to slay your quota, though, or you won't receive any recognition for your deeds.

1�Give Adoulin's population some peace of mind by embarking on these expeditions every so often. Also, rumors about far more terrifying beasts are likely to surface the further we progress into Ulbuka's interior, but as long as you stick to your duties, you should have no reason to fear them.

1�For these assignments, you'll need to transport provisions to the sites of future frontier stations. You can now use waypoints and still receive commendations, but be prepared to hear stories about ��back in my day, we had to walk all the way out and back on our own two feet,�� from some wily veterans.
1�Frontier stations are paramount to sustaining the colonization effort. Tasks of greater magnitude can't even begin without one, so building these structures should always be a priority.
1�You will sometimes be charged with carrying supplies from specific frontier stations to the Couriers' Coalition.

1�By supplies, I mean ones obtained in the jungle through pioneering. Yes, acting as a beast of burden may not be the most glamorous duty, but it is a vital one if we're to improve the coalitions and keep Adoulin economically stable.

1�The most effective way of supporting those risking their lives on the front lines is by supplying designated frontier bivouacs with the necessary provisions. While it may go against previous Couriers' Coalition policy, the use of waypoints is henceforth permitted on this type of assignment.

1�Truth be told, frontier bivouacs are not as developed as their station counterparts, but they still play an important role in the colonization of the continent. If they don't receive provisions regularly, our supply lines to the stations will wither and die.

1�Travel to places unknown in search of ergon loci, areas overflowing with natural energy. While some say it's the journey--not the destination--that matters, failing to survey even a single locus will leave you both depleted of energy and empty-handed.

1�The potency of an ergon tincture is highly dependent upon the strength of the ergon locus from which it's extracted, so a thorough investigation must be made into each location if we're to successfully use this trump card we've created.

1�Completion of these assignments means providing the Scouts' Coalition--and no others, for they are the only ones to possess the proper facilities--with unique and extraordinary materials from certain territories.

1�The jungle is teeming with obscure and unfamiliar substances, and from them we hope to derive more powerful and effective materials with which to aid the colonization effort. Science waits for no man, however, and without periodic deliveries of new samples, our research will stagnate.
1�The proper equipment and tools are instrumental in the colonization movement's progress--and the Inventors' Coalition apparently wants to be the one to corner the market.

1�While the Inventors' Coalition doesn't particularly care how you obtain what they ask for once you're in the specified location, they are quite picky about the number you obtain and the fact that you can't deliver to anyone else.

1�Pioneers are an intrepid band of adventurers, but the nature of their trade makes them prone to losing personal effects. Pick up any lost articles in the territory to which you are dispatched and return for a reward along with a pat on the back.
1�This is probably the least garish service the Mummers' Coalition provides, but it's one for which pioneers throughout Adoulin are eternally grateful.

1�Though they may not be the friendliest of Ulbuka's inhabitants, that doesn't mean the fiends who populate the continent can't teach us a thing or two. Research designated beasts by personally experiencing their special attacks and report what they taught you...if you live to tell the tale.

1�The Mummers' Coalition is constantly searching for its muse in all manner of sources, one being the myriad monsters scattered throughout the jungle. Investigating monsters' behavior may be just the inspiration they need to concoct new dances, gags, and events!

1�The isolation of the frontier can eat at even the most independent of us, which is why it's important to give our pioneers something to cheer about. Head to specified frontier stations and lift the spirits of the workers there! Just remember that if they don't smile, you don't get rewarded.
1�Dance, sing, shout, or generally make a fool of yourself. It doesn't matter how you do it, as long as you can make them laugh and forget their cares for a few moments.
1�This coalition is edified as much as possible, and therefore we have no plans to expand.

1�First my back, now my shoulders... Sometimes I wonder if I'm really cut out for this sort of work.
1�Gotta catch me a look at one of those cute little creatures again someday.
1�Huh? You got somethin' to ask me?
1�What's this now? You're lookin' fer info about them leafkin? Cute little buggers, boy howdy!
1�Every time they send me off to some frontier station or other I take a quick look fer 'em, but they're too clever to get caught.

1�I got a monster of a tale for you, though! One time I done seen one down in Foret de Hennetiel. He was fiddling around wit' somethin' or other down by the Zoldeff River. I almost went down to check it out fer myself...but, you know, tight schedules 'n all.
1�Stupid coalitions and the damn work they give me. I'd rather go fishing down there and see if I can catch another glimpse of 'em.
1�Researchers from the Civic Arboretum bought the total remaining stock of 5����, if what I've heard is to be believed.
1�A word of advice: if you're interested in pioneering, you need to keep your body in tip-top shape.
1�I mean, really. All wet behind the ears. No way you'll move up around here for years to come!
1�Not another person coming to ask me about leafkin!
1�Don't tell me you think they're adorable, too? Dumb creatures only get in my way.
1�Get this--I was in the Yahse Hunting Grounds, just minding my own business, see? And one of the stupid beasties hurls a rock at me!
1�Where, you ask? Hmm... Let me take a look at my map...Yeah, somewhere around J-6.
1�Hey, if you want to chase 'em down, that's your call. Just don't come crying back to me if you end up with a couple lumps on your head.
1�On behalf of the Mummers' Coalition, I welcome you to Adoulin.

1�Unlike the other coalitions, our support of you pioneers is rather indirect. We provide all manner of recreational and relaxation services to help you get back into the field well-rested and ready for action.

1�Well, as long as you're here, you might as well let me give you a brief description of them.
1�I'll bet you're just itching to catch a glimpse of the excitement, aren't you?
1�Well, you'll be able to scratch that itch soon enough, for another bout is scheduled in the not-too-distant future. Just don't scream yourself hoarse rooting for one that catches your eye.
1�There won't be any need to worry about that. The raptor tournament is going to be canceled.

1�Impeccable timing, as always. There is a matter I wish to discuss.
1�Oh? What could the Peacekeepers' Coalition want with me?

1�We managed to find it before it caused any real damage, but if we had been even a moment later...

1�I turned my head away just for an instant, and before I knew it...

1�Clear your mind and ready your chronological senses, for this amusement pits you against time's dilatory creep. The objective here's to speak to me a certain amount of times at the intervals I tell you.

1�Just so you know, I'll only give you the length of time to wait and how far off you were from the specified interval when spoken to. Furthermore, the difference between your guess and the answer is cumulative.
1�If you're too slow one round, you can make up time by being a little fast the next.
1�Finally, you claim victory by staying within a certain number of seconds by the end of the final round. I hope this cleared things up, and enjoy honing your mastery over Father Time.
1�Even pioneers like you seeking refuge in amusements can't escape the time's inevitable ticking. The last time you played this game, you were disqualified for exceeding the time limit.

1�You can also use them to negate the effects of my remedies or limit the amount of water I can pour.

1�On the other hand, remedies help increase or decrease either the amount of the water you can pour or the amount of water in the goblet. As a final twist, they can also negate the effects of afflictions.
